title: Disney Parks History
description: Journey through Disney theme park history!

questions.question: What was the first attraction Walt Disney personally worked on at Disneyland?
questions.explanation: Jungle Cruise was an opening day attraction in 1955 that Walt personally helped design.

questions.question: EPCOT stands for Experimental Prototype Community of Tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Walt envisioned EPCOT as a real working city of the future, though it became a theme park instead.

questions.question: Which park was NOT open on Walt Disney World's opening day in 1971?
questions.explanation: Only Magic Kingdom and two resorts opened in 1971. EPCOT opened in 1982.

questions.question: What was the first international Disney park?
questions.explanation: Tokyo Disneyland opened in 1983, making it the first Disney park outside the United States.

questions.question: What year did Hollywood Studios (originally Disney-MGM Studios) open?
questions.explanation: Disney-MGM Studios (now Hollywood Studios) opened on May 1, 1989.

questions.question: Disney's Animal Kingdom is the largest theme park at Walt Disney World.
questions.explanation: At approximately 580 acres, Animal Kingdom is the largest Disney theme park in the world.

questions.question: What company originally sponsored Spaceship Earth at EPCOT?
questions.explanation: AT&T was the original sponsor of Spaceship Earth when EPCOT opened in 1982.

questions.question: What was Disneyland's opening day famously called due to problems?
questions.explanation: Opening day had counterfeit tickets, broken rides, and a heatwave, earning it the name 'Black Sunday.'
